Short Biography

Professional qualifications

  • FIAA – Fellow of the Institute of Actuaries of Australia
  • CERA – Chartered Enterprise Risk Actuary
  • GAICD – Graduate member of the Australian Institute of Company directors
  • Actuary SAA – Fully Qualified Actuary with the Swiss Association of Actuaries

Academic Appointments

  • [2020 - ] – Professor (Full) of Actuarial Studies, Centre for Actuarial Studies, Department of Economics, Faculty of Business and Economics, University of Melbourne, Australia
  • [2015 - 2020] – Associate Professor of Actuarial Studies, School of Risk and Actuarial Studies, UNSW Australia Business School, University of New South Wales (UNSW), Australia
  • [2015 - 2018] – Professeur associé en actuariat1, Département de Mathématiques et de Statistique, Faculté des Arts et des Sciences, Université de Montréal (UdeM), Canada
  • [2013 - 2015] – Professeur agrégé en actuariat2, Département de Mathématiques et de Statistique, Faculté des Arts et des Sciences, Université de Montréal (UdeM), Canada
  • [2013 - 2015] – Adjunct Associate Professor, School of Risk and Actuarial Studies, UNSW Australia Business School, University of New South Wales (UNSW), Australia
  • [2010 - 2013] – Senior Lecturer of Actuarial Studies, School of Risk and Actuarial Studies, Australian School of Business, University of New South Wales, Australia
  • [2008 - 2010] – Lecturer of Actuarial Studies, School of Actuarial Studies, Australian School of Business, University of New South Wales, Australia
  • [2005 - 2008] – Various casual lecturer positions, University of Lausanne & Bordeaux Business School
  • [2003 - 2008] – Teaching and Research assistant, University of Lausanne

Professional Appointments

  • [2023 – 2026] – Non-Executive Director, Management Board of the Theatre Royal (Hobart, Tasmania). Member (Chair from 2025) of the Finance, Audit, and Risk Committee (FRAC).
  • [2021 – 2022] – Elected Councillor, Caulfield Junior College. Convenor, Policy Review and Development Subcommittee
  • [2020 – 2022] – Elected Board Member, École Française Melbourne (EFM) Vice-President since 2021
  • [2018 – 2019] – Non-Executive Director, Lycee Condorcet the International French School of Sydney
  • [2014 – 2015] – Actuarial consulting, Service de consultation en actuariat (Université de Montréal)
  • [2008 – 2012] – Non-Executive Director, Fondation Comoedia, Switzerland (group insurance)
  • [2007 – 2008] – Founder, Executive Director, Fondation Comoedia, Switzerland (group insurance)
  • [2006 – 2008] – Executive Director, Chair, Fondation de prévoyance Artes et Comoedia, Switzerland (pension fund, 200 employers, 2000 insured)
  • [2004 – 2004] – Consultant, La Suisse Assurances (actuarial department for group life), Lausanne, Switzerland

Education

  • 2008: PhD – University of Lausanne, Faculty of Business and Economics (HEC Lausanne), Actuarial Science (supervisor: Prof. Hans U. Gerber)
  • 2005: Lic Oec – University of Lausanne, Faculty of Business and Economics (HEC Lausanne), Business, major in Actuarial Science

International Research Awards

  • 2025: Melville Actuaries Summit Prize, awarded by the Australian Actuaries Institute for the paper Dynamic Financial Analysis (DFA) of General Insurers under Climate Change which was presented at the 2025 All-Actuaries Summit (Sydney, Australia).
  • 2025: Carol Dolan Actuaries Summit Prize, awarded by the Australian Actuaries Institute for the paper Dynamic Financial Analysis (DFA) of General Insurers under Climate Change which was presented at the 2025 All-Actuaries Summit (Sydney, Australia).
  • 2023: Hachemeister Prize, awarded by the Casualty Actuarial Society (CAS) for the paper Ensemble distributional forecasting for insurance loss reserving which was presented at the 2022 ASTIN Colloquium
  • 2022: Highly Commended Paper Prize, awarded by United Kingdom Institute and Faculty of Actuaries for the paper SPLICE: A Synthetic Paid Loss and Incurred Cost Experience Simulator (published in the Annals of Actuarial Science)
  • 2018: Taylor Fry General Insurance Seminar Silver Prize, awarded by an independent panel for the paper How to proxy the unmodellable: Analysing granular insurance claims in the prescence of unobservable or complex drivers (Australian Actuaries Institute General Insurance Seminar, November 2018)
  • 2017: Hachemeister Prize, awarded by the Casualty Actuarial Society (CAS) for the paper Correlations between insurance lines of business: An illusion or a real phenomenon? Some methodological considerations (2016, ASTIN Bulletin, 46:2)

Other Academic Awards

  • 2024: Prize for Exceptional Distinction in Research: Research Excellence (Level D-E) category, The University of Melbourne Faculty of Business and Economics and Melbourne Business School Deans’ Excellence Awards.
  • 2018: The Dean’s Distinguished Leadership Award in recognition of exceptional and sustained contributions to the achievement of the goals of the UNSW School of Business and Strategy 2025.
  • 2011: Australian School of Business Teaching Excellence Award: for “Outstanding Technology-Enabled Teaching Innovation Business School Deans’ Excellence Awards.
